New Records: Pete Alonso became the first player in MLB history to hit a go-ahead home run with his team trailing in the ninth inning or later in a winner-take-all playoff game.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run home run in the top of the ninth inning to give the Mets the lead and ultimately win the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets were coming off a come-from-behind victory over Atlanta in a doubleheader earlier in the week, showcasing their resilience.
Post-Match Reflections: Pete Alonso expressed pride in contributing to the team's victory and highlighted the team's hard work throughout the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets' victory marked their second win in the best-of-three series, advancing them to the next round of the playoffs.
